summary: Jeremy Ray Akers is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears on multiple payroll certification reports from February 1977, November 1977, and December 1977. These documents list his name, social security number, and salary, confirming his employment with the committee during that period. The payroll certifications indicate that he was performing assigned duties as a staff member of the HSCA.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Jeremy Ray Akers' significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While the specific nature of his duties is not detailed in the provided documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during a portion of its investigation.
